name: Clomethiazole (Heminevrin)
summary: A sedative-hypnotic used primarily for the short-term management of severe insomnia and agitation, and in some countries for alcohol withdrawal.
description: Clomethiazole is a thiazole derivative with potent sedative and hypnotic effects. It acts as a GABA-A receptor positive allosteric modulator, similar to barbiturates and benzodiazepines, but with a distinct chemical structure. It is primarily used in Europe for short-term treatment of severe insomnia in the elderly and for controlling agitation in acute alcohol withdrawal. Due to its dependence potential and risk of respiratory depression, it is usually restricted to inpatient or closely supervised use.

metadata.prescription_status: Prescription Only (restricted use in some countries)

items: Short-term treatment of severe insomnia, particularly in elderly patients
Management of agitation in acute alcohol withdrawal

sections.text: Clomethiazole enhances the effects of GABA at the GABA-A receptor, increasing chloride ion conductance and hyperpolarizing neuronal membranes, leading to sedation and hypnosis.

sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; reduced clearance possible

sections.text: Rapid onset within 15–30 minutes; duration of sedation 4–6 hours.
